description: Number of ways to express 2n+1 as p+2q where p and q are primes.
comments: This is related to a conjecture of Lemoine (also sometimes called Levy's conjecture, although Levy was anticipated by Lemoine 69 years earlier). - Zhi-Wei Sun, Jun 10 2008The conjecture states that any odd number greater than 5 can be written as p+2q where p and q are primes.
references: L. E. Dickson, "History of the Theory of Numbers", Vol. I (Amer. Math. Soc., Chelsea Publ., 1999); see p. 424.
H. Levy, "On Goldbach's Conjecture", Math. Gaz. 47 (1963), 274.
